generateAllGroupPlots(func)¶

This function generates a plot for each group with the grades/pass% of each subject depending on func If the period is not the first, plots have a series with the previous period

Parameters:func – The function to use for aggregating grades, either np.mean or self.percent
Returns:
generateAllGroupStatsPlots()¶

This function generates a plot for each group: 0-2 not passed, 3-4 and 5 or more for current year and period

:return:creates plots with 2 subplots, the first one an histogram with the number of students with X not passed subjects, and another pie diagrm with promotion information (0-2,3-4,>4) Also returns a dic with groups as keys and [number of not passed subjects, number of studengs with all passed, 1-2 missed, 3-4 missed,>4 missed]

generateCoursePlots(func)¶

This funcition generates 3 plots for each course: One for AG languages, another for D and the last one for all of them for current year and period If the period is not the first, plots have a series with the previous period All plots have a series with the average of the last “5” years

Parameters:func – The function to use for aggregating grades, either np.mean or self.percent
Returns:
generateCourseStatsEvolutionPlots(nyears=5, includelast=False)¶

This funcition generates a plot for each course: 0-2 not passed, 3-4 and 5 or more with the average stats of each period for the las 5 courses :return:creates a plot with the average stats of each period for the las 5 courses

generateCourseStatsPlots()¶

This funcition generates a plot for each course: 0-2 not passed, 3-4 and 5 or more for current year and period :return:creates plots with 2 subplots, the first one an histogram with the number of students with X not passed subjects, and another pie diagrm with promotion information (0-2,3-4,>4) Also returns a dic with courses as keys and [number of not passed subjects, number of studengs with all passed, 1-2 missed, 3-4 missed,>4 missed]

generateDeptPlots(func)¶

This funcition generates 3 plots for each course: One for AG languages, another for D and the last one for all of them for current year and period If the period is not the first, plots have a series with the previous period All plots have a series with the average of the last “5” years

Parameters:func – The function to use for aggregating grades, either np.mean or self.percent
Returns:
generateFinalGrade()¶

This function geneates new rows with the final grade for each year-studet-subject This final grade is the las ordinary one if passed or the extraordinary one.

generatePiePlot(missed, name)¶

Generates a pie plot from the missed list

Parameters:
  • missed – a list with the number of students for each number of not passed subjectcs
  • name – the name for the title of the diagram
Returns:

None, it stores the plot in the filesystem
generatePiedata(missed)¶
Parameters:missed – a list with the number of students for each number of not passed subjectcs
Return p:a list with 3 values, number of students with <=2 not passed subjects, number of students with 3-4 not passed subjects, number of students with >=4 not passed subjects
Return prom:a list with the number of students with 0-1-2 not passed subjects
Return risk:a list with the number of students with 3-4 not passed subjects
Return danger:a list with the number of students with 5-6... not passed subjects
Return left:a list for with the x coordinates of the diagram bar
Return legendhist:
 a list with the number of not passed subjects as legend for the diagram bar
generatePlot(diagram, func, coursegroup)¶

Generates a bar plot from the diagram dataframe

Parameters:
  • diagram – Dataframe with the data to be ploted
  • func – it can be the average of the grades (mean) or the percentaje of passed for each subject
  • coursegroup – only needed to create the filename
Return figurefile:
 

The name of the stored plot (not the path)

generateStatsAllStudents(mod=None, groups=None, doc=False)¶

Generates a html file foreach group, which includes a table with each student marks (present and past periods) and also a graph with the same data plus a column with the average of the course

generateStatsCourse(year, ebals, mod=None, course=None)¶
generateStatsGroup(group, diagrams=True)¶

#FIXME: ebal and ebals!! for a year, period (ebals[-1], ebals should be alist), ebal is only used for titles. and a group generates: 0- A list with all subjects passed % 1- A list with subjects with less than 70 of students passess, and its % 2- Average grade for each subject 3- Number of not passed subjects, and average grade for each student 4- Name for the pie plot 5- Name for subjects mean plot 6- Name for subjects percentaje plot Optionally if diagrms=True also generates those plots

generateStatsStudent(student, fullname, groupgrades, doc=False)¶

generates html with a table for the students with subjects and his marks side by side with all group marks studentgroupgrades is a DataFrame with those marks

Parameters:
  • student – uniquename of the student
  • fullname – The name of the studetns to use as title for the diagrams and filename
  • groupgrades – the grades of the group of the student to create a comparative diagram
  • doc – a textdoc() object to append the report of the student (default False)
Return html:

html code with the report of the student (grades)

getData(year, periods, period=1, excludedCourses=[])¶

Configures course and group ploting

Parameters:
  • year – The year whose marks will be plotted
  • periods – Evaluative period list
  • period – Current period as int (as index+1 for the list)
  • excludedCourses – Courses that won’t generate a plot
Returns:

None, it creates the dataframe with the data from the database
getGroupPromStats(group)¶

Generates stats about failures in the specified group, for the configured year and period [66.66666666666667, 13.333333333333334, 20.0], 2.2666666666666666

Parameters:group – name of the group
Returns:p - a list with the percent of students in each situation (promoting <= 2 susp, risk 3-4 susp, danger > 4 susp) and the average of fails for students

notPassedStats(dfgrades)¶

From a list returns a dic with the number of not passed subjects and students

Parameters:dfgrades – a grades series with names as index

uniquename

aabadiacaj 0

aalvardiaz 0

acarvalper 8

agarciacha 0

ajimenemen2 0

aruedasbal 2

ausandilor 0 ...

Return gradescount:
 a dic with the number of not passed subjects and student number

defaultdict(<class ‘int’>, {0: 10, 1: 5, 2: 5, 3: 3, 4: 1, 5: 2, 6: 1, 8: 3})
